hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Momentum
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a period of extreme volatility compression (BTC 20-day realized volatility < 30% annualized) within a NEUTRAL regime, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper band on expanding volume (>1.5x 20-day average) signals the start of a directional volatility expansion phase, providing a momentum edge for the next 5-10 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low volatility in neutral markets often precedes significant directional moves as pent-up energy releases. The combination of compression, a clear technical breakout, and volume confirmation filters false signals. The current news environment (Trump crypto policy, JPMorgan bullish targets) creates latent directional bias that may be triggered by technical catalysts.
entry_conditions: BTC price closes above 20-day Bollinger Band upper band (2 std dev)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches 1.5x the Bollinger Band width (measured at entry) from entry point
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes below the 20-day moving average

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain momentum, with price reverting below the moving average within 3 days more than 45% of the time, or subsequent volatility remains below 40% annualized despite the breakout.
